Index Updaters¶

class ceda_elasticsearch_tools.index_tools.index_updaters.IndexUpdaterBase(index, host, port)¶

Base class for index updaters. Contains common methods.

class ceda_elasticsearch_tools.index_tools.index_updaters.CedaDirs(index, host, port)¶

Class to aide in updating and managing the ceda-dirs index. Includes hooks to allow MOLES to trigger changes in the directory index.

backfill_above_path(path)¶

Backfill MOLES collection information above given path.

Parameters:path – Path to back fill metadata from
update_title(url, title)¶

MOLES title has been changed. Update titles for all records matching url.

Process:

1. Update by query based on url
Parameters:
  • url – MOLES record URL
  • title – New title to apply
update_path(url, new_path, title, record_type='dataset')¶

MOLES record path has been changed. Update directories to have correct information.

Process:

1. Get all matching records by url
2. Get all matching records by new path
3. Diff the results to get back_fill list
4. Clear MOLES information for all matching records
5. Apply MOLES information to all records matching paths
6. Back fill after change:

    - Take difference between queries
    - Poll MOLES API to get dataset/collection info
    - Apply to reduced set of files
7. Back fill above new location
Parameters:
  • url – URL for the dataset/collection
  • new_path – New path to apply metadata to
  • title – Title of the MOLES record
  • record_type – MOLES record type. (default: dataset)
update_dataset(url, path, title, record_type='dataset')¶

A new dataset has been created in MOLES. Add dataset information to relevant directories.

Process:

1. Update by query below path
2. Back fill above new location
Parameters:
  • url – MOLES URL to add to matches
  • path – Directory path to update dataset information below
  • title – MOLES record title to add to matches
  • record_type – MOLES record type. (default: dataset)
update_collection(paths)¶

A new collection has been created in MOLES. Add collection information to relevant directories.

Process:

1. Back fill paths with collection
Parameters:paths – List of paths to update
delete_catalogue_record(url)¶

Delete MOLES information for records matching url

Parameters:url – URL of deleted MOLES record
update_readmes(readme_content)¶

A new 00README has been added to the archive. Update directories with new content. Will fail if the directory does not already exist in the index.

Returns:Status - Success|Failed
add_dirs(directories)¶

New directories have been added to the archive. Add directories to directories index

Parameters:directories – List of dictionary items containing information to be processed in request. Path key is required. eg. [{“path”: “/neodc/sentinel1b/data/IW/L1_SLC/IPF_v2/2018/09, “record_type”: “Dataset”}, …]
Returns:Status - Success|Failed
delete_dirs(directories)¶

Directories have been deleted from the archive. Remove directories from the index.

Parameters:directories – List of dictionary items containing information to be processed in request. Path key is required. eg. [{“path”: “/neodc/sentinel1b/data/IW/L1_SLC/IPF_v2/2018/09”}, …]
Returns:Status - Success|Failed
class ceda_elasticsearch_tools.index_tools.index_updaters.CedaFbi(index, host, port)¶

Class to aide in updating and managing the ceda-fbi index.

delete_files(files)¶

Files have been removed from the file system and need to be removed from the index

Returns:
check_dir_count(dir_list)¶

Takes a list of directories and counts the number of hits in each directory. Returned as raw elasticsearch response:

[
    {"responses":[
        {
            "hits:[],
            "aggregations":{
                "file_count":{
                    "value":<count>}
                }
            }
        }
    ]},...
]
Parameters:dir_list – List of directories
Returns:
check_files_existence(file_list)¶

Wrapper class to underlying operations. Takes a file list and returns a list containing the JSON response formatted as below:

[           # Container for the reponse
    [       # Collection of all the responses in a block as submitted to elasticsearch
        []  # Indiviual query responses
    ]
]
Parameters:file_list – List of files to test
Returns:List of JSON response objects
